benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: POST Valid Payload scenarios: TC01-04, TC18 (creation and verification) are covered; successful responses and payload integrity are validated.
Edge-case validations: TC19 (max/min lengths), TC20 (special characters), TC21 (injection) are covered.
Invalid input handling: TC06 (invalid ID format), TC07 (missing CreatedBy header), TC08 (malformed body), TC09 (missing body) are covered as negative test cases.
Missing header handling: TC07 specifically tests missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header.
Authorization handling: TC12 covers unauthorized access scenarios.
Non-existent entity handling: TC05 covers 404 when invoice item does not exist.
Empty payload handling: TC10 validates 201 with an empty array.
Large payload handling: TC14 covers maximum payload size behavior.
Unknown/extra fields handling: TC11 tests extra/unknown parameters and their impact.
Duplicate handling: TC17 covers behavior with duplicate custom field names.
Concurrency: TC16 tests concurrent requests to the same endpoint.
System state variations: TC22-TC25 cover empty DB, partially populated DB, degraded performance, and transient failures.
Performance: TC15 validates response time for normal payload and TC24 covers degraded performance expectations.
Integration: TC18 confirms persistence and retrievability via GET after POST.
System error handling: TC13 covers service unavailable (503) scenarios.
Recovery from transient network: TC25 validates retry behavior without duplication.
gaps: Rate limiting / throttling tests for POST are not present.
Internal server error (500) scenario is not explicitly tested (only 503).
Caching headers / caching behavior are not applicable to POST but not explicitly tested.
Content-Type edge cases (unsupported media types) are not tested explicitly.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests to simulate high-frequency POST requests and verify throttling or proper error handling.
Add an explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario to ensure proper server-side failure handling beyond 503.
Add tests for Content-Type validation and unsupported media types to ensure proper 415/400 responses when the payload is not JSON array or has incorrect media type.
Consider adding GET-side checks for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) to complement the GET coverage and document caching behavior.
Extend concurrency tests to include potential DB-level race conditions and ensure deterministic outcomes under contention.
Clarify and document expected behavior for extra unknown fields (TC11) in the API spec to reduce ambiguity during testing.
